{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3536687,"name":"Justin Spurlock","username":"Snake51","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T21:01:27.516Z","cooked":"

Our team is working on getting Pathplanner to work on our robot. We are using a swerve drive, and are using all of the code that is given on Pathplanner.dev. However, every time that we attempt to enable in autonomous, the code crashes, giving us the following error:

  • NT: Got a NT4 connection from 10.59.0.202 port 52063

  • NT: CONNECTED NT4 client ‘shuffleboard@3’ (from 10.59.0.202:52063)

  • Pose2d(Translation2d(X: 15.83, Y: 2.05), Rotation2d(Rads: -3.14, Deg: -180.00))

  • Unhandled exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot read the array length because “this.modules” is null

  • Error at frc.robot.subsystems.DriveSubsystem.getPositions(DriveSubsystem.java:160): Unhandled exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot read the array length because “this.modules” is null

  • The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error.
    The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.
    See Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation for more information.

  • at frc.robot.subsystems.DriveSubsystem.getPositions(DriveSubsystem.java:160)

  • at frc.robot.subsystems.DriveSubsystem.resetPose(DriveSubsystem.java:193)

  • The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

  • at com.pathplanner.lib.auto.AutoBuilder.lambda$resetOdom$10(AutoBuilder.java:513)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.FunctionalCommand.initialize(FunctionalCommand.java:52)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SequentialCommandGroup.initialize(SequentialCommandGroup.java:66)

  • at com.pathplanner.lib.commands.PathPlannerAuto.initialize(PathPlannerAuto.java:573)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler.initCommand(CommandScheduler.java:169)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler.schedule(CommandScheduler.java:212)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler.schedule(CommandScheduler.java:243)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command.schedule(Command.java:538)

  • at frc.robot.Robot.autonomousInit(Robot.java:61)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.IterativeRobotBase.loopFunc(IterativeRobotBase.java:350)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot.startCompetition(TimedRobot.java:133)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:419)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.startRobot(RobotBase.java:510)

  • at frc.robot.Main.main(Main.java:23)

  • Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:433): The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error.

  • The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.

  • See Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation for more information.

  • Error at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:440): The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

  • ********** Robot program starting **********

  • NT: Listening on NT3 port 1735, NT4 port 5810

  • NT: Got a NT4 connection from 10.59.0.202 port 52098

  • NT: CONNECTED NT4 client ‘shuffleboard@1’ (from 10.59.0.202:52098)

  • NT: Got a NT4 connection from 10.59.0.8 port 38132

  • NT: CONNECTED NT4 client ‘photonvision@2’ (from 10.59.0.8:38132)

  • NT: Got a NT4 connection from 10.59.0.16 port 33456

  • NT: CONNECTED NT4 client ‘photonvision@3’ (from 10.59.0.16:33456)

  • Instantiating navX-Sensor on roboRIO Serial Port 2.

  • NavX: Library for FRC

  • NavX: Opening USB serial port to communicate with navX-MXP/Micro.

  • NavX: Connected.

  • NavX: startup initialization and startup calibration complete.

  • NavX: onboard startup calibration complete.

  • NavX: Yaw angle auto-reset to 0.0 due to startup calibration.

  • NavX: Board Type 50 (navX2-Micro (Gen 2))

  • Retransmitting stream configuration command to navX-MXP/Micro.

  • NavX: Board Type 50 (navX2-Micro (Gen 2))

  • NavX: firmware version 4.0.433

  • ********** Robot program startup complete **********

  • Loop time of 0.02s overrun

  • Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.IterativeRobotBase.printLoopOverrunMessage(IterativeRobotBase.java:436): Loop time of 0.02s overrun

  • CommandScheduler loop overrun

  • buttons.run(): 0.034688s

  • Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Tracer.lambda$printEpochs$0(Tracer.java:62): buttons.run(): 0.034688s

  • DriveSubsystem.periodic(): 0.087594s

  • SmartDashboard.updateValues(): 0.008459s

    robotPeriodic(): 0.640624s
    LiveWindow.updateValues(): 0.000111s

  • Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Tracer.lambda$printEpochs$0(Tracer.java:62): buttons.run(): 0.000093s

The error suggests that your code for creating path-based commands is running before the drivetrain has been initiliazed, so when it’s trying to get information about the (swerve-)modules, that array of modules is empty/null:

Snake51:

Error at frc.robot.subsystems.DriveSubsystem.getPositions(DriveSubsystem.java:160): Unhandled exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot read the array length because “this.modules” is null

Maybe it’s as simple as moving the initialization of your drivetrain so that it happens before you’re trying to use that for the creation of paths
